description: Triangle of prime numbers in which n-th row lists all primes p such that 1/p has decimal period n, n >= 1.
comments: The number of numbers in each row n is given by A112505(n).In the 18th century, the Japanese mathematician Ajima Naonobu (aka Ajima Chokuyen) gave the terms through 5882353 (Smith and Mikami, p. 199). - _Jonathan Sondow_, May 25 2013
references: Ajima Naonobu (aka Ajima Chokuyen), Fujin Issh≈© (Periods of Decimal Fractions).
links: T. D. Noe, Rows n=1..276, flattened
David Eugene Smith and Yoshio Mikami, A History of Japanese Mathematics, Open Court, Chicago, 1914; chapter X.
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Decimal Expansion.
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of 1/n
mathematica: pp={}; Do[f=Transpose[FactorInteger[10^n-1]][[1]]; p=Complement[f, pp]; pp=Union[pp, p]; Print[p], {n, 66}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Sep 08 2005 *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
